Eu não consigo explicar o quão bom e perfeito é esse jogo, este é muito melhor que o primeiro em muitos sentidos, mais complexo na questão de puzzles, é tudo muito fluido, diálogos ainda mais divertidos que o primeiro, altos plot twists e a luta final é uma cópia do primeiro jogo, só que bem mais foda.
What else is there to say?

Gra, która wzbogaciła niemal każdy aspekt poprzedniczki. Nowe elementy zagadkowe, wraz z wybornymi żelami na czele. Imponujący jak na owe czasy system fizyki. Wzbogacenie historii o początki ośrodku Aperture. Świetni bohaterowie, dialogi i relacje między nimi. Tryb kooperacyjny sprawdza się wyśmienicie, a gra ostatni raz pokazała, że wszystkie gry Valve z 2 w tytule są lepsze od poprzedniczki. Jednakże osobiście klimat pierszej części portal'a był lekko lepszy, jest to jednak osobista opinia.
Warte immer noch auf Portal 3

Just because it has a 2 behind it's name doesn't mean it's bad. At least not in this case. Portal 2 builds on everything you know from the first game and adds a new layer of that insane, Aperture charm to it. Where the first game only really had you and GLaDOS, you'll be quite surprised how much more alive have the labs gotten. The story feels much longer, too.
Did I mention we have multiplayer now? We have a multiplayer now. Invite your friend.

Well worth every cent at full price.

The way I got here was: I tried the first Portal demo, I liked it, and I bought the Portal+Portal 2 bundle. Highly suggest you do the same.

Вторая часть увлекла меня значительно сильнее чем первая.

Compared to portal, this game is amazing. The story is awesome, the level design is great, the environments are mysterious and make you think, and they just nailed what portal needed to be. I like puzzle games but this definetly has to be my favorite one. It likes to give you experiments and allows you to experiment with the items and mechanics you are shown/given. The Co-op is also pretty funny if you have a friend to tag along with, and I like how they added the ability to make your own test chambers. The main problems I had with the game however is that I didn't really find myself to be replaying the game as I kinda already knew what to do in each of the puzzles, but I think this is fixed by the level editor. I also like how they tried to make the game seem less "level" like and more like an actual linear story, although in some areas you will notice it just feels like a bunch of maps that "test your IQ". However other than that I'd definitely recommend this game. I give this a solid 8.5/10.
